google_play_reviews.content: Thanks for that. I was able to make a negative value now when using a different keyboard as you suggested. Thank you
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I looked this up and apparently it's a known issue on certain Samsung devices with the new text input fields. It should work if you're using GBoard instead of the default Samsung keyboard. I will keep an eye out for a solution but I think this is a Samsung issue unfortunately.

google_play_reviews.content: This app was perfect for me but you recently just removed the ability to have predefined multiple choice options. Why?? Now the app has erased my predefined options and I need to type in an option each time I need to track something. Also, the tracker modal pop up use to fit well on the screen but now everything is way over sized so I need to scroll to see everything. When will this be fixed?
Date always wrong during the input. Eg Enter today date, it record yesterday date. Everytime one day behind. Please fix it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Update. This should be fixed in v3.0.2 which will be released shortly. Sorry for this once again.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent idea... Thank you üíì
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Glad you like it ‚ò∫Ô∏è

google_play_reviews.content: Don't know how to reply so I'm editing this review. The biggest problem I have is with the select time clock, it used to have a 24-hour clock which is what I use. In addition you could edit the current time, just adjust the wheel by 5 minutes instead of entering the whole thing from scratch. I also liked the old font better especially on the numbers, but that's an issue of taste so you're free to disregard it. Overall very satisfied with the app, been using it for over 1y Hope this reaches you!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Update. If you update to v3.0.1 the clock is now 24 hour again. This was a bug. I will probably add a setting for it in a later release

google_play_reviews.content: Exactly what I was looking for to track my health statistics. No ads. No cost. Thank you!
Great job keep developing please. Offset and scale are good but I would like 2 independent y-axis
Really nice app for tracking anything. I use it to correlate back pain, exercise and medication.
Some errors in averages but excellent for ad hoc analytics

Not easy to figure out, but once you do it is great for recording and graphing anything as a function of time. Improvements I would like to see: * A way of deleting a block of entries. * More flexibility in what time range to display. * Display the multiple vertical scales on the graph.
Great App, I wish it had the option for a scatter plot/trendline, so stuff like weight loss can be visualized better.
Good app.Cery simple and easy to use .It doesn't ask for crazy permissions either. The only thing I'd like is a year end overview for all the different things I tracked on one chart.

amazing. has everything I want (graphs with multiple tracks,offsets, scale modifier). the only thing is that percentage tracks aren't implemented. it would be nice to have It relative to the min and max of the graph
Thank you very much for this application. It is very customisable and a good fit for any person who loves to track progress
Using this for a year or 2 and I can say it's my go to on seeing what I did each month and each year.
Really simple and handy for tracking arbitrary things versus other things

Fantastic well designed app that does the job and does it well. A very clean UI and I am already addicted to it. I'm using it to track my weight and it's nice to see a trend on the graph display. Well done devs!! üôÇ
Thank you for making this, it's exactly what I've been looking for. The only thing missing is the graph widget, otherwise it's perfect :)
I like it, only that I would wish the gragh to be accurate with the numbers fed in. If you say starting from 10 then it gives a very different and huge number.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: It sounds like you're referring to offset and scale? Offset will be added to each value in the graph, scale is multiplied by each value. If you've used a moving average or total period, the scale and offset are applied afterwards. This is defined in the FAQ: "how are moving averages and plot totals calculated"

google_play_reviews.content: Just the app Ive been looking for. Thanks!

Using F-droid version, I would really like some additional features, like some sort of math tracker or at least something that can calculate the difference between each two adjacent data points and perhaps graph/other resizing to tracker size for less awkward setups, or perhaps a sparkline on the tracker itself?...

Horrible to use. I don't know how people say it's easy.. I see no graph lines it's hard to add to a graph that shows nothing. I dud correct tracked and everything wasted my time as it shows a graph but no bars so I can't determine anything . Uninstalling..

I was looking for an app to create line graphs to track my body weight training progress. Tried so many body weight training apps, ironically none of them recorded stat's very well... But this app is perfect! Thanks for making this for us! It's the best tracker app available!
Does what it says on the tin. Would love a graph widget as well as the trackers
I'm a simple user and for me this is just perfect.
Is pretty much forwards, very easy to edit as your life can change every minute . Glad I am using this app ;-).

It's so simple and quick to input values and notes. There's various options for creating trackers and graphs and the app has everything I need for tracking various things. I've been using it for a while now and I'm able to get useful insights from the data. The in-app FAQs are helpful for learning how to create various types trackers and graphs. Overall super useful app.

What a great little app!!! Easy to collect data, graphs are elegant and automatically update. Exactly what I needed. It has a reminder function, and maybe it could be improved by an "every 5 minutes" interval setting, but that's not enough of an omission to take away even one star. Thanks for making this!
Great functionality with no strings attached. Thank you very much!
Awesome app
Heyy. Im able to track stuff but how do i see data in a graph format?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You must add a graph using the menu in the top right. If you are unsure take a look at the FAQ section in the app :)

google_play_reviews.content: Uses wrong time zone when add new measurements
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi. The data points are stored as a local date/time and an offset from UTC. Essentially the time shown should always be the time it said on your device clock when you tracked the event. So if you track at 3:15 then go to a timezone 1 hour earlier and track at 2:15 the first data point will still say 3:15 but the order will be preserved on a graph.

google_play_reviews.content: Does exactly what I expect it to.
Very good concept ..please add legend and cross hair with values in the graph.. thanks
No ads an is open source
Plz help me where to see the graph, I've put the numbers but the graphs are where to be found
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You must create the graphs you want. The + drop down in the top right had 3 items: "Tracker", "Graph or Stat" and "Group". Select Graph or Stat and then set it up to show the data from your tracker

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app! Powerful, flexible, customizable, and easy to use. No fluff, takes up very little space, and has already replaced 4 different apps on my phone, none of which were fully meeting my needs.
awesome app!

Wish I could give this app more then 5 stars. I love this app. I'm huge fan of tracking things and will start my own business very soon. I love how I can track my Marketing, Advertising, job size and more.. Love this app. And it is so easy to set it and organize everying
Does exactly what it advertised.

Great app, almost programmed it myself just to have something similar üíØ But I want to track all of my dofferent workout activities and it would be really usefull to have a way to add two different trackers together for a graph or a new tracker. For example if I have two different trackers for training legs, and I want a graph showing me my total tracked leg activities, I would have to manually add them together. So that feature would be very much appreciated! üòá
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you. There is a complex proposed solution to problems like this that I'm working on at the moment. See issue 69 on the git hub page. Could take me a while though üòâ

google_play_reviews.content: Good app overall! Does the job neatly. Add Tasker plugin for automated tracking ability
Free, open source, ad-free.
Hey I really loved this app. It's simple and exactly what I need. Can you include the feature of a "chart" widget. I am ready to pay for the version including that widget.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, I am aware there are a few people who would like this feature but it looks like it could be tricky to implement so I don't think this will happen soon. The app is open source so it is possible someone will implement it. Thanks.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent app - just what I needed - very high quality
Excellent tool to track progress on one's goals

Love it! I looked everywhere for something to track what i want. This isn't for someone who wants something automated, but it's amazing if you want to figure out what you want to track and even make your own graphs. And everything can be exported to analyze with other data. Only thing I would request is having some sort of cloud backup even if we have to pay for it.
A good app for tracking whatever you like,good material deaign, knew the fdroid version, came for play store one on my other phone. Deserves more attention in my opinion

Really great! I love the graphs and the time since displays, and it's really easy to build up groups and views. I tried several habit trackers and this is my favourite. My only issue is that exporting only does trackers, only the visible trackers in a group and doesn't let you export all trackers at once. Ideally, I'd like to be able to export everything in one go; the groups, the trackers, the graphs and their positions in the app. Then I could share the information and setup between devices.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for the review. There is a backup option that will create a file containing all of the above as a SQL file. You can then use restore to import them into another device. It will overwrite everything though so be careful.

google_play_reviews.content: Awesome app. Thank you. Really need to have a bar graph though. I use this for tracking personal goals. As they say, if you want to improve at something, track it. And that really works for.

On one hand, it's pretty good at what it does. On the other, I really wish I could select colors for multiple choice items on graphs, but they seem to be chosen arbitrarily. I also wish I could use a color picker to pick my colors.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You can select the colours from a predefined set by clicking on the coloured circle for line graphs. They are not currently configurable for pie charts. You are correct that there is not currently a colour picker. Hopefully this can be implemented in the future.

google_play_reviews.content: How curious, I'd posted a review. Well, the app is great, so far! I would like it if, for my interest of use, it were possible to have 16 option selections per tracker, instead of only 12. Further, how many groups, trackers per group, charts per group, and tracker lines per chart are possible? What other limits might the app have, because it doesn't seem to be many. Thank you.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: There is an issue tracking this here: https://github.com/SamAmco/track-and-graph/issues/65 .. The issue is there are only 12 colours and there is no colour picker right now. Once a colour picker is implemented there should be no restrictions at all. There are no plans for this development in the near future though I'm afraid.

google_play_reviews.content: This is excellent but it would be more amazing if the line chart also shows the loss/growth between each data point
This app has potential. There need to A LOT more contrasting color options for the graphs. Also, I want to go back and add past data...
Good
I just installed this app and it seems to be doing exactly what I was looking for, thank u very much!

Really smooth UX experience, powerful functionality, the idea of having tracking groups is intuitive once you get around to it. I always try to leave a review of good open source apps because they deserve it. Cheers.
An excellent app with no ads or permissions, perfect for tracking finances, can even import/export in csv format to local storage.

Oh yeah it's Sqlite3 database file but I think you should add option for importing "csv" or "Tabbed text" (widely used stuff)... Well now the problem is how do I import? pretty sad thing right? Any other way?
google_play_reviews.replyContent: No backup & restore only supports one format specific to this app. If you want to import data from CSV you can but you need that CSV in a specific format also. I suggest you read the FAQ on export and then try export some data from the app to see the format.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple, flexible, powerful. Very quick to add data entries. I use this to track weight, medication doses, pain levels, garden harvests, dog walking times, and anything else in my life where I need a time log. The app also lets you graph measurements, individually and with others. This app has replaced about a dozen other clunky, intrusive, overly-specialized apps I was trying to use for these tasks.
Seems to have everything but ability to export reports. Thanks for sharing this app with the world!
Best app,no fancy disturbing UI, not opinionated, gets the job done

Well done! Simple to use and very suited for my purpose of tracking multiple related data points over time. A few small criticisms: 1) icons for plot type (line only, with dot, dot & value) are hard to see in dark mode. 2) would be nice to select multiple points for delete (or use a condition e.g. delete all where timestamp before given value - or current selected datum). 3) add values for multiple data with the same timestamp - perhaps something like a "entry group" property of each data set.
Does exactly what I ask of it.
Not useful as mentioned

I wish there was a bar chart as well but great app. I am tracking like 100s of things there. EDIT: mainly beautiful. At the moment in Multiple Choice I am using hack to track in same graph. In morning medicine I am using 0 No 1 Yes, In evening I am using 0 No then No again for 1 and then Yes for 2. This way lines don't overlap. In one over other bar, it will be clearly visible. For instance bar will be one over other then first bar red then on the top of it blue.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: I'm curious what advantage a bar chart presents over a line graph? How would you use this differently? Or is it just aesthetic? You can use totals and change the style of the points to show a number per point on the line graph. I imagine this covers all bar chart use cases?

google_play_reviews.content: Brilliant app, very versitle. No unreasonable permission, or popups. Only missing a tally feature. E.g. I want to keep track of coffee I take, and I can't just +1 to the data set. I have to rewrite the number manually then reset it manually to 0 each evening so I don't start the day with 6 coffee lol. Same for other daily tally data sets. If you added a '+1' & 'reset to zero' at a custom time, that would greatly improve it. Still, I am very pleased with what's on offer here. *response: I want to see specific mood differences throughout the day in relation to coffee's drunk. I.e. does a cup of coffee cause mania, mood dip etc? After how many coffees does my mood alter significantly? Do my energy levels fall off after coffee three? Simply using a daily total does not tell me this information, it's not specific enough to demonstrate mood and energy shifts minutes and hours apart. Don't get me wrong, I can work around it, but adding my proposed additions would resolve the issue entirely and allow more flexible data entry and interpretation. Just a suggestion. It's still the best software for tracking such things and displaying them in graph format.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Richard, thanks for the review. The way I would solve this personally is to have a tracker that is numerical with default value 1 and then create a graph of that data that plots daily totals. You wouldn't reset the tracker but you would be able to see the number of coffees you had drunk every day.

google_play_reviews.content: This is the best I found for tracking things..
Amazing app!
So helpful for a quick & varied way of tracking lots of daily things in one place. This ap has helped me to keep on top of my routines and habits.
Exactly what I've been looking for. Graphs, pie charts and more in an easy to use app with a clean interface.

I was searching for this kind of app where I can track multiple different activities or emotional states of my self. With the ability to compare the different connections between them using graphs. The application it self is very simple and have a space for improvement. But I glad it exists on the market, probably one and only for now.

This app is perfect to help me track progress along several quantifiable goals. After the initial tracking group is set up, it's super easy to enter new data for all the tracked quantities all at once. The graphs are simple, and the scale feature allows a comparison between numbers that would otherwise not fit on the same graph.
Okayish. Develop for widget of graphs, future predictions etc.
Awesome app
I am so glad that I found this! More after I use it a bit. I was having trouble finding a food and symptom tracker that allowed for more flexibility and made correlations. üëç

A simple yet useful app for the things I wish to track. I'm using it to log weight and other data from my non-smart weighing scale. I'll be able to replace a few apps with this app. There's no smart syncing with devices or other apps and services, but sometimes it's not necessary.
Simple and powerful. Thank you!

Not bad. Easy to use but a few changes wild make it more useful. Values only presented in the graph at 1 decimal place. I need it to be 2 ideally for me. Thanks for pointing out about global notes. If they could they be added from the graph and have editable colour marks that stayed on screen that would be perfect!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thanks for the feedback. I will have a look into decimal places, the precision needs to adapt to the input data ideally. Also global notes are possible directly from the notes menu. When you look at a graph full screen, you can tap on a note and it will place a marker for you.

google_play_reviews.content: I'm satisfied with what I can currently do with this app. But I want to copy enteries from another tracker as default entry to this new tracker. Also, I want to do some basic math, A-B, A+B+10, A/B etc... For example, evaluate duration between tracker A(left home) and B(reached office). Finally, something like a streak counter would make me uninstall every other tracker app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback :) I will consider a streak counter and tracker copying for a future release. I agree that some more maths functions would be super useful too, I've often thought about this but I've not found a good way to implement it yet (or the time as this could get tricky). Often you can solve this with multiple trackers for now.

google_play_reviews.content: Useless
Really? Really? I put restore data it took me to my files and I miss clicked, then your trash app deleted my progress, all my progress. DO NOT DOWNLOAD YOUR WASTING YOUR TIME.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: You should not have lost the data you were trying to restore from. Have you tried going back to the restore page and restoring from the file again? All current app data is wiped when you restore, this is written above the restore button (it is often a good idea to back up before restoring just in case).

google_play_reviews.content: Pretty awesome. Would be cool if they add the time value aside from the numerical and mulitple choice. Also, can I request that we can have a graph widget options too? Thank you =D
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks, I'm glad you're enjoying the app. I have added the time option in the latest release. I must admit graph widgets are not high on my priority list right now as I think they will be quite tricky and I think there are other things I can do to add more value with that time.

google_play_reviews.content: Love this app. Was a little confusing at first but figured it out.

Edit: a huge improvement would be an option to add to any line graph a curve for the sum and one for the average of the plotted curves. Since the points of the several curves can have different abscissae, this feature should assume a linear interpolation between any two successive known points of a same curve.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Update: I believe I have now found the cause of this bug and the fix should be released very soon (pending review from Google Play). Thank you for helping me find this and for your patience.

google_play_reviews.content: Simple but perfect for basic custom tracking. It's a little confusing at first with the track/graph groups but very easy to use once I got the hang of it (there are some FAQs that but I did not look at them). At this time, the app is regularly being updated to provide new features and become more useful. Great job, devs!
Please add option for entering time duration. I want to track how long I can plank
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. This is on my todo list but unfortunately I don't have a huge amount of time to work on this project right now. Thank you for your patience.

google_play_reviews.content: Excellent
Did not ask for value. Did not function as designed
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Hi Stephanie. Perhaps you used the timestamp only data type? If you try again using numerical or multiple choice it should ask you for a value.
